name: purport
notes:
> **let’s stay connected!** sign up for email updates [on the site,][1] and receive new, free knit and crochet patterns weekly, exclusive coupons, and free goodies you won’t find anywhere else! ***new email subscribers also receive a coupon for 15% off of their first order!*** it’s our happy, positive place on the internet! xoxo

**we are having a yearlong mystery knit along (mkal) on ravelry. click [here][2] to learn more and to join in on all the fun!**

this pattern is free for a limited time. just add to cart and complete checkout to receive the download. for more info, click [here][3]. be sure to sign in to your account before you check out, so when future clues go live, you'll only need to login and re-download the pattern to receive the next clue.

use code: purport-final15 to take 15% off all our expression fiber arts [oasis fingering][4] yarns today.

sizes:

approximately 52" diameter (132 cm), blocked

materials: 

expression fiber arts [oasis fingering][8] yarn (500 yds/457 m per 3.5 oz/100 g skein) 

**purport will require 12 different colored skeins total.**

**recommended [oasis fingering][9] clue colors (meadow palette) – color a: cherish, color b: diaphanous, color c: grace, color d: frothy pink, color e: light reading, color f: foliage, color g: ceres, color h: cypress, color i: captain, color j: rooted, color k: take chances, and color l: grayscale**

if those colors aren't available, any from [this category][10] will work.

* we’re also putting together an alternative set of [oasis fingering][11] colors that could be used for the 2025 mkal. the clue colors in this celestial grove palette are: a) abyss, b) late night storm, c) mercurial, d) unsolved mystery, e) pine, f) crystal, g) granite, h) orenda, i) sommelier, j) look within, k) sunkissed serenity, and l) au lait oasis fingering.

needles: 
us size ​​5 (3.75 mm) circular needles or size needed to obtain gauge

us size 5 (3.75 mm) double-pointed needles [dpns]
 
skill level: 
 
adventurous beginner to intermediate: this project is for knitters who know basic stitches and are ready to combine them in new ways to create intricate-looking patterns.
 
notes from the designer:

“new year, new me.” “this year‘s gonna be my year!” “this year, i resolve to…”

have you ever said one of those phrases and later chastised yourself? things don‘t always go as planned, and too often, we become our own worst critics. we forget that yearlong (or longer!) commitments are hard. we fail to extend grace to ourselves in the same way we might extend it to others. let‘s try to break that bad habit together as we stitch through this project. the goal of this knit-along is to bring you joy. it's an opportunity to learn new stitch combinations, to play with color, and to create something special, knowing that other knitters around the world are right beside you, cheering you on. if you don‘t finish, that‘s okay! if you do finish, congratulations!

one of my favorite aspects of knit-alongs is the camaraderie they engender. we celebrate when things go right; we commiserate when things go wrong; we remind each other that no matter how things go, we are in this together. we demonstrate kindness to one another—the same kindness each of us should give ourselves. 

* click [here][12] to watch a video about this month's clue.
* the sample shawl used approximately 1207 m / 1320 yds in total: color a) 46 m / 50 yds, color b) 55 m / 60 yds, color c) 110 m / 120 yds, color d) 105 m / 115 yds, color e) 124 m / 135 yds, color f) 119 m / 130 yds, color g) 101 m / 110 yds, color h) 110 m / 120 yds, color i) 91 m / 100 yds, color j) 105 m / 115 yds, color k) 101 m / 110 yds, and color l) 142 m / 155 yds. 
* **it is important that you save all of your leftover yarn until the end.**
* gauge isn't crucial but can affect overall dimensions and yarn amounts.

*designed by janica york carter*

you'll receive a digital file only (instantly downloadable as a pdf) and won't be shipped anything. please allow a few minutes for the download link to be emailed to you. if the email doesn't arrive within a few minutes, just log into your account on our site, and you'll see your completed orders. from there, you'll find the download link.

enjoy your knitting!

chandi
